author: Jami Frankenberry
title: All-Tidewater 2014 | Baseball
text:
ALL-TIDEWATER FIRST TEAM PLAYER OF THE YEAR
ZACH RUTHERFORD , Western Branch, Senior outfielder/infielder/pitcher
Staff ace who helped the Bruins win the Group 6A state championship – the program’s first since 2004. Finished 11-1 on the mound with a 1.29 ERA and 10 complete games. Batted .479 with 30 RBIs, 30 runs scored and 19 stolen bases. Played first base, third base, outfield and pitcher. Monitor-Merrimac Conference Player of the Year and All-South Region co-Player of the Year. Signed with Old Dominion. Read more about Rutherford
____
JEFF ADAMS , Maury, Senior outfielder/pitcher
Batted .492 with two home runs and a .723 slugging percentage. On the mound, went 7-1 with a 3.41 ERA. Atlantic Conference Player of the Year and first-team All-South Region (5A). A four-year starter at Maury, headed to Tufts University. ____
CHASE ANDERSON , Granby, Junior third baseman/pitcher
Went 8-0 with a 0.83 ERA on the mound and batted .359 for a team that won the Coastal Conference No. 1 seed. Coastal Conference co-Player of the Year. “He is everything you want out of a player.” Granby coach Robbie Butler. ____
DEVON FISHER , Western Branch, Senior catcher
Batted .450 and threw out all five baserunners who attempted to steal. First-team All-Monitor-Merrimac Conference and All-South Region (6A). Signed with Virginia, but instead accepted a contract offer from the Boston Red Sox, who made him a 20th-round draft pick. ____
LOGAN HARRELSON , Great Bridge, Senior pitcher/outfielder
Staff ace who finished 6-1 with a 1.95 ERA and 40 strikeouts over 40 innings – and only five walks. Batted .387 with six doubles and 22 RBIs. PenSouth Conference Player of the Year and second-team All-South Region (5A). ____
AUSTIN HENRY , First Colonial, Junior shortstop
Batted .418 with 12 RBIs, a .580 on-base percentage and 20 runs scored. Nearly flawless in the field, committed only three errors all season. First-team All-Coastal Conference and All-South Region. “Gets to many balls that many shortstops don’t get near.” First Colonial coach Scott Stubbe. ____
CARTER HERON , Cox, Senior second baseman
Batted .471 with 22 stolen bases and 16 RBIs. First-team All-Coastal Conference and second-team All-South Region (6A). “A great year as a leader and on the field.” Cox coach Bill Conroy. ____
COLBY HIGGERSON , Great Bridge, Junior shortstop/pitcher
Led Great Bridge with a .421 batting average and finished with 12 stolen bases and six doubles. On the mound, finished 2-0 and struck out 20 batters over 11 innings in relief. First-team All-PenSouth Conference and second-team All-South Region (5A). Committed to Radford. ____
CULVER LAMB , Tallwood, Senior third baseman/pitcher
Struck out 97 batters – and walked only 10 – over 57 innings and compiled a 7-2 record and 0.36 ERA on the mound. Batted .377 with nine doubles and 19 RBIs. Coastal Conference co-player of the year and first-team All-South Region (6A). Signed with VMI. ____
CHRISTIAN LOWRY , Hickory, Senior outfielder
Batted .413 with five home runs, 12 doubles, 14 stolen bases and 17 RBIs for a team that won the Group 5A state title – the program’s first state championship. First-team All-PenSouth Conference and All-South Region, and a two-time All-Tidewater first-team selection. Signed with Virginia. ____
DAVID MULAC , Kellam, Senior first baseman
Batted .465 with 22 RBIs for a team that finished second in the Atlantic Conference. Committed only one error this season while playing mostly at first base and some behind the plate. First-team All-Atlantic Conference and All-South Region (5A). ____
TYLER NELIN, Kellam, Junior infielder/catcher/pitcher
One of the Region’s most versatile players, spending time at first base, third base, pitcher and catcher. Batted .418 with 15 RBIs and on the mound compiled a 6-2 record with a 2.28 ERA. First-team All-Atlantic Conference and All-South Region (5A). Committed to George Mason. ____
KIETON RIVERS , Nansemond River, Junior shortsop
Anchored a team that went unbeaten during the Ironclad Conference regular-season and tournament. Batted .481 with 20 RBIs, eight doubles, 17 stolen bases and 27 runs scored. Ironclad Conference Player of the Year. Committed to Coastal Carolina. ____
SECOND TEAM
Greg Beale , Nansemond-Suffolk, senior shortstop/pitcher
Andrew Bullock , Grassfield, junior third baseman
Justin Cook , First Colonial, sophomore first baseman
Connor Eason , Hickory, junior pitcher
Paul Hall , Maury, juinor outfielder/pitcher
Justin Hayes , Western Branch, senior outfielder
Joe Jackson , Maury, senior catcher
Jack Markey , Norfolk Academy, senior shortstop/pitcher
Zach Milligan , Norfolk Christian, junior catcher
Mikey Polansky , Hickory, freshman third baseman
Trevor Riggs , Nansemond River, senior outfielder
Dane Smith , Great Bridge, senior second baseman
Robert White , Indian River, senior pitcher
___
PILOT KEEPSAKES
Were you or someone you know featured on this year's All-Tidewater team? Want a keepsake plaque that’s a replica of your article? Call (757) 446-2762 or visit The Pilot store .
